messages.subject: Re: trim posts, and I love this list!
messages.msgSnippet: I got really confused for a bit until I realized what I was reading was untrimmed posts. please remember the folks on digest! TIA! :) ... and also the
messages.messageBody:
I got really confused for a bit until I realized what
I was reading was untrimmed posts. please remember the
folks on digest! TIA! :)

these all had me giggling:

> You mean they're not carried by a swallow? Not even
> by two swallows,
> carrying it on a line between them?
>
> Nancy (tying the topic to film, comedy, Arthurian
> legends,
> geography...)

> I'd take the good parts and turn away as blithe as a
> woodland fairy
> from the nutty parts.
>
> Sandra

and also the authority defiant in NYC, which I missed
in my copying and pasting somehow. ROFL!

and this reminded me of something strange--
> "I'm nobody, who are
> you. Are you nobody two?
> There's the two of us." Emily Dickinson's beautiful
> poem...

I wrote this poem standing waiting for the bus one
morning in 7th grade. really. I had never heard of
emily dickenson, never seen it, and totally recreated
the exact poem. I didn't know it was an emily
dickenson poem until I was in my twenties. freaked me
out! I think I must have been channeling her or
something :D

I love this list!
Julia, also authority defiant, oppositional,
passive-aggressive, and just plain stubborn in NWGA
